wikitext.*:
'''''gûl''''' is a word used in both [[Sindarin]] and the [[Black Speech]] (derived from the former).<ref name=P4k>{{MR|P4k}}, p. 350</ref><ref name=PE1779/>

==Etymology==

*[[Elvish]] ''ngōl-''<ref name=PE1779>{{PE|17}}, pp. 11, 79</ref> (from [[Sundocarme|root]] [[NGOL]])<ref name=Ety377>{{LR|Etymologies}}, p. 377 (root ÑGOL-)</ref><ref name=WJC>{{WJ|C}}, p. 383</ref>

==Sindarin==

In Sindarin, ''gûl'' originally referred to "secret knowledge, arts"<ref name=WJC/> or "the deeper knowledge of the 'wise' or skilled persons".<ref name=PE1779/> However, the word came to be associated with [[Morgoth]]'s black arts  (as in the compound ''[[morgul]]'').<ref name=WJC/> It is therefore also found glossed as "evil or perverted knowledge, necromancy, sorcery".<ref name=P4k/>

==Black Speech==

In the Black Speech, ''gûl'' (or ''gūl'') is glossed as "([[phantoms|phantom]], shadow of dark [[magic]], necromancer), slave, servant?", "[[Demons|[evil] spirit]]". In ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]'', ''gûl'' is translated as "[[wraiths]]" (as in ''[[Nazgûl]]'', the Ringwraiths).<ref name=PE1779/>

==Compounds==

*''[[morgul|mor'''gul''']]''
*''[[Nazgûl|Naz'''gûl''']]''
*''[[guldur|'''gul'''dur]]''

==Cognates==

*[[Quenya]]: ''ñóle''<ref name=WJC/>
*[[Telerin]]: ''góle, engole''<ref name=WJC/>

==Other versions of the legendarium==

In the [[The Etymologies|''Etymologies'']] appears the [[Noldorin]] form ''gûl'' ("magic").<ref name=Ety377/>
